oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-02-07 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 7, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer) and his Rainbow Ranch Boys, guest performer Carl Butler, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1009th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Rainbow Ranch Boys; Archie Campbell; Carl Butler; Tommy Jackson; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- Father Time And Mother Love (Hank Snow and his Rainbow Ranch Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Carl Butler -- The Blues Come Around (Carl Butler) -- Prince Albert commercial (Carl Butler, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Gooden (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Hank Snow and Grant Turner talk -- The Last Mile Of The Way (Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Hank Garland -- Galloping On The Guitar (Hank Garland)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Minnie Pearl; Campbell, Archie; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Snow, Hank; Rainbow Ranch Boys; Butler, Carl
